principles: Make those above you feel comfortably superior.
rules: Do not go too far in displaying your talents or you might accomplish the opposite-inspire fear and insecurity.
Make your masters appear more brilliant than they are and you will attain the heights of power.
warnings: You have more to fear from friends than from enemies.

principles: Keep people off-balance and in the dark to gain an advantage.
Use reputation as a means of power and protect it at all costs.
Stand out and be conspicuous to draw attention.
rules: Conceal your intentions until it's too late.
Say less than necessary to avoid saying something foolish.
Make others do the work for you, but take the credit.
Use bait to lure others into a trap.
Win through actions, not arguments.

claims.claim: Reputation is the cornerstone of power.
You can die from someone else's misery due to emotional contagion.
Keeping people dependent on you maintains your independence.

warnings: Avoid associating with unhappy and unlucky individuals.
Don't teach others enough so they can do without you.
Be cautious of the consequences of selective honesty and generosity.

principles: Use spies to gather valuable information that will keep you a step ahead.
Play the spy yourself. In polite social encounters, learn to probe.
rules: Crush your enemy totally.
Do not build fortresses to protect yourself-isolation is dangerous.
Know who you're dealing with-do not offend the wrong person.
Do not commit to anyone.
Play a sucker to catch a sucker-seem dumber than your mark.

claims.claim: A timely gift-a Trojan horse-will serve the same purpose.
When asking for help, appeal to people's self-interest, never to their mercy or gratitude.
You must learn when to leave. Create value through scarcity.

warnings: If one ember is left alight, no matter how dimly it smolders, a fire will eventually break out.
The enemy will recover, and will seek revenge.
Too much circulation makes the price go down: The more you are seen and heard from, the more common you appear.

principles: Mastering the art of indirection and flattery can lead to success in a world where power and political dexterity are key.
Being bold and taking risks is often more effective than being timid or cautious.
rules: Use others as scapegoats and cat's-paws to disguise your involvement in mistakes and nasty deeds.
Give people options that come out in your favor, making them feel they have control but are actually puppets.

claims.claim: People have an overwhelming desire to believe in something, and offering a new cause or faith can bring you untold power.
Everyone has a weakness or gap in their defenses, which can be turned to your advantage if discovered.

warnings: Acknowledging a petty problem gives it existence and credibility, making it stronger.
Showing contempt for something you cannot have is sometimes the best revenge.

principles: Establish your own name and identity to gain power
Strike at the source of trouble to neutralize its influence
rules: Do not wait for troubles to multiply, do not try to negotiate with irredeemable individuals
Neutralize the influence of strong individuals who cause trouble

claims.claim: Coercion creates a reaction that will eventually work against you
You must seduce others into wanting to move in your direction

warnings: Ignoring the hearts and minds of others will lead them to hate you

chapters.chapter_title: DISARM AND INFURIATE WITH THE MIRROR EFFECT
rules: When you mirror your enemies, doing exactly as they do, they cannot figure out your strategy.

claims.claim: Few can resist the power of the Mirror Effect.
Making a show of one's weakness is actually a very effective strategy, subtle and deceptive, in the game of power.

principles: There are no principles; there are only events.
rules: Master your emotions to gain power.
Distance yourself from the present moment and think objectively about the past and future.
Play with appearances by wearing many masks and keeping a bag full of deceptive tricks.

claims.claim: Those who claim to be nonplayers may affect an air of naivete, but beware for it can be an effective means of deceit.
Genuinely innocent people may still be playing for power and are often horribly effective at the game.
The only means to gain one's ends with people are force and cunning.

warnings: Powerlessness will make you miserable.
Anger is the most destructive of emotional responses, for it clouds your vision and makes situations less controllable.
Love and affection can be potentially destructive, in that they blind you to the often self-serving interests of those whom you least suspect of playing a power game.

principles: Patience is a skill that must be learned and mastered.
Never discriminate as to whom you study and trust.
Never trust anyone completely and study everyone, including friends and loved ones.
rules: Always make those above you feel comfortably superior (Law 1: Never Outshine the Master).
Do not go too far in displaying your talents or you might accomplish the opposite - inspire fear and insecurity.
Make your masters appear more brilliant than they are and you will attain the heights of power.

claims.claim: Power is a game, and in games you do not judge your opponents by their intentions but by the effect of their actions.
You must learn to inwardly laugh each time you hear someone's justifications for their actions.
Never waste valuable time or mental peace of mind on the affairs of others - that is too high a price to pay.

warnings: Power is endlessly seductive and deceptive in its own way.
It might be better to turn back if you use the book for entertainment, as it can lead to becoming lost in the labyrinth of power.
The gods of power frown on the frivolous; they give ultimate satisfaction only to those who study and reflect.

principles: Outshining the master can be a mistake when it comes to power.
Giving glory to the master is more important than providing financing.

claims.claim: Galileo's strategy of linking the Medicis' name with cosmic forces gave them infinitely more glory than making them patrons of a scientific gadget or discovery.
Scientists must serve masters who hold the purse strings and give them glory to avoid insecurity.

warnings: Showing off one's talents can stir up resentment, envy, and other manifestations of insecurity.
Outshining the master can lead to insecurity and make them feel inferior.

chapters.chapter_title: Law 15: Avoid Outshining Those Around You
rules: You can inadvertently outshine a master simply by being yourself.
Never take your position for granted and never let any favors you receive go to your head.

claims.claim: Outshining a master is fatal.
Superiority is odious, but the superiority of a subject over his prince is not only stupid, it is fatal.

principles: A person's sense of gratitude can be a weakness, leading them to make decisions that benefit their benefactor rather than themselves.
Allowing someone to see power up close can lead to an insatiable desire for more power and control.

claims.claim: Michael III was betrayed by his friend Basilius, who used their friendship to gain power and ultimately kill the emperor.
The pattern of violent and bloody coups in Chinese history is a result of emperors being surrounded by enemies and having no one they can truly trust.

warnings: Do not underestimate the potential for betrayal from those you consider friends or allies.
Be cautious when granting power or favors to others, as it can create an expectation of reciprocation that may not be fulfilled.

principles: It is natural to want to employ your friends when you find yourself in times of need.
The key to power, then, is the ability to judge who is best able to further your interests in all situations.
rules: Do not rely on friends for help; instead, use your enemies and transform them into reliable subjects.
Keep friends for friendship, but work with the skilled and competent.

claims.claim: Using or hiring friends will inevitably limit your power.
Skill and competence are far more important than friendly feelings in achieving success.

warnings: Ingratitude has a long and deep history; be wary of expecting gratitude from a friend.
The receipt of a favor can become oppressive, and the injury will come out slowly.

principles: Conflict is key to power and growth.
A worthy opponent can help you grow stronger.
Never let the presence of enemies upset or distress you.
The man of power welcomes conflict, using enemies to enhance his reputation.
rules: Never pick a fight with someone you are not sure you can defeat.
Use such enemies to define your cause more clearly to the public.
A sharply defined enemy is a far stronger argument for your side than all the words you could possibly put together.

claims.claim: Mao's strategy of constant conflict has several key components.
Without clear-cut enemies, his people would lose any sense of what Chinese Communism meant.
A friend can be used to greater effect than an enemy in certain situations.

warnings: Nothing is stable in the realm of power, and even the closest friends can be transformed into the worst of enemies.
You must never let your guard down when working with friends or using them as scapegoats.

principles: To surrender to one's guidance, targets must be appropriately confused.
You have to scramble your signals - appear interested in another person (the decoy), then hint at being interested in the target, then feign indifference, on and on.

claims.claim: Men and women are very different, but when it comes to seduction they feel the same.
Deep down inside, targets often sense when they are being seduced, but they give in because they enjoy the feeling of being led along.

warnings: Do not be held a cheat, even though it is impossible to live today without being one. Let your greatest cunning lie in covering up what looks like cunning.

principles: Conceal your intentions to gain power and influence.
Use deception and misdirection to achieve your goals.
rules: Do not be open or honest about your true intentions.
Create a smoke screen of distractions to conceal your real purpose.

claims.claim: Most people are predictable and can be deceived by appearances.
Honesty is often seen as a blunt instrument that offends rather than inspires respect.

warnings: Do not underestimate the power of deception and misdirection.
Be cautious when dealing with individuals who appear overly sincere or honest.

principles: Create a familiar front to conceal true intentions
Use a smoke screen to distract and divert attention

claims.claim: The Yellow Kid's con was successful due to his ability to create a convincing smoke screen
Geezil was unaware of the true nature of the boxing match and fell victim to the scam

warnings: Be cautious of familiar fronts that may conceal ulterior motives
Distrust situations where attention is diverted from important details

principles: A gentle and peaceful exterior can be a sign of great power and cunning.
rules: When dealing with someone who is suspicious or wary, it's best to create a sense of calm and trust before striking.

claims.claim: Haile Selassie was able to unify Ethiopia by using his charm and obsequiousness to lure his rivals into traps.

warnings: Don't underestimate the power of a gentle and peaceful exterior, it can be a sign of great cunning and ambition.

principles: People can only focus on one thing at a time, making it difficult for them to imagine that the bland and harmless person they are dealing with is simultaneously setting up something else.
rules: Use a bland and inconspicuous front to avoid raising suspicion.
Envelop your mark in the familiar, the banal, the harmless to conceal your intentions.
The grayer and more uniform the smoke in your smoke screen, the better it conceals your intentions.

claims.claim: A smoke screen is a weapon of great power that can be used to deceive and manipulate others without them noticing.
The best deceivers utilize a bland and inconspicuous front that calls no attention to themselves.

warnings: Do not underestimate the power of deception, as it can be used to devastating effect even by those who appear weak or harmless.

principles: Conceal your purpose and hide your progress; do not disclose the extent of your designs until they cannot be opposed, until the combat is over.
Win the victory before you declare the war.

claims.claim: No smoke screen, red herring, false sincerity, or any other diversionary device will succeed in concealing your intentions if you already have an established reputation for deception.
The world wants to be deceived.

warnings: If you already have a reputation for deception, it is better to own up and appear the honest rogue, rather than persisting in playing naive and risking being seen as the rankest hypocrite.
Powerful people with bland exteriors can practice their deceptions in the same place throughout their lifetimes.

principles: The less you say, the more powerful and in control you appear.
Impressing people with words can make you seem common and out of control.
rules: When trying to impress people, say less.
Avoid saying something foolish by being cautious with your words.
warnings: Saying too much can lead to saying something foolish.

principles: The power of words can be a double-edged sword, capable of inspiring awe or causing offense.
A person's ability to control their words is a reflection of their self-control and worthiness of respect.
rules: Those who squander their treasure of words will not accrue power.
It is better to say less and maintain a powerful aura than to speak too much and risk offending others.

claims.claim: Coriolanus's arrogance and inability to control his words led to his downfall.
The human tongue is a beast that few can master, and those who fail to tame it will suffer the consequences.

warnings: The misuse of power and the failure to consider others' feelings can lead to severe consequences.
Those who seek to exploit their reputation for personal gain will ultimately be exposed and punished.

principles: A leader should not be swayed by the opinions of others, but rather make decisions based on their own judgment.

claims.claim: Louis XIV was a man of very few words.
He would often say 'I shall see' to indicate that he would make a decision without consulting others.

warnings: A leader's silence can be misinterpreted as weakness or indecision.

principles: Effective communication can be a powerful tool for gaining influence and control.
rules: Ministers should be mindful of their words and actions, as they can have significant consequences.

claims.claim: Louis's silence was a key factor in his ability to maintain power and control over those around him.

warnings: Saying foolish things can be more damaging than doing them, especially for ministers.

principles: The less you say, the more profound and mysterious you appear.
Silence can make others uncomfortable and reveal valuable information about them and their weaknesses.
Saying less than necessary is not for kings and statesmen only; it's a strategy that can be employed in most areas of life.
rules: Never start moving your own lips and teeth before subordinates do.
Be careful with sarcasm, as the momentary satisfaction gained will be outweighed by the price you pay.

claims.claim: Once words are out, you cannot take them back.
Reputation is the cornerstone of power; once it slips, you're vulnerable and will be attacked on all sides.

warnings: Silence can arouse suspicion and insecurity, especially in your superiors.
A vague or ambiguous comment can open you up to interpretations you hadn't bargained for.

principles: The power of reputation can be used to intimidate and influence others.
A strong reputation can put a vast army on the defensive, even force them into retreat without a single arrow being fired.

claims.claim: Chuko Liang's reputation as the 'Sleeping Dragon' was so powerful that it could be used to intimidate and influence others.
P. T. Barnum's reputation was ruined by Chuko Liang, but he was able to recover and establish a new reputation.

warnings: The dangers of underestimating the power of reputation
The importance of maintaining a strong reputation in business

principles: A good reputation can double your strength and send people scurrying away from you.
Reputation has the power to make or break a person's success.
Establishing a solid reputation takes time and effort, but it can create an aura of respect and fear.
rules: Make your reputation simple and base it on one sterling quality.
Use someone else's good name to whitewash and elevate yours if you have stained your own reputation.
Protect your reputation strictly when establishing it, anticipating all attacks on it.

claims.claim: A person's reputation can precede them and inspire respect, making a lot of their work done for them before they arrive on the scene.
Reputation is a treasure to be carefully collected and hoarded, especially when first establishing it.
An attack on another man's reputation is a potent weapon, particularly when you have less power than he does.

warnings: It is easier to cope with a bad conscience than with a bad reputation.
Outright slander and insult are too strong at this point; they are ugly, and may hurt you more than help you.
If you do not break your enemy's reputation dearly, you will ina

principles: Never go too far in attacks, for that will draw more attention to your own vengefulness than to the person you are slandering.
Use subtler tactics, such as satire and ridicule, to weaken your opponent while making yourself out as a charming rogue.
rules: Court scandal. Do anything to make yourself seem larger than life and shine more brightly than those around you.
Make no distinction between kinds of attention - notoriety of any sort will bring you power.

claims.claim: Reputation is critical; there are no exceptions to this law.
Everything is judged by its appearance; what is unseen counts for nothing.

warnings: Never let others decide your reputation for you. Be the master of your fate, and also of your reputation.

principles: To attract attention, one must create a crowd; as surely as the lodestone attracts iron.
Once people's eyes are on you, you have a special legitimacy.
Creating interest means creating a crowd.
rules: Do something different and odd to create curiosity.
Welcome personal attacks and do not discriminate between different types of attention.
Court controversy, even scandal, to draw attention.

claims.claim: The quality of the attention is irrelevant; all kinds will work in your favor.
To avoid being a flash in the pan, you must not let attention veer toward other people at your expense.
Attention-whether negative or positive-is the main ingredient of success.

warnings: The worst fate for a man who yearns fame, glory, and power is to be ignored.
To avoid being ignored, one must constantly seek attention and create controversy.

principles: Constantly renew attention by adapting and varying methods to court attention.
Use mystery to beguile, seduce, even frighten.
People feel superior to the person whose actions they can predict.
rules: Do not show all your cards.
Never make it too clear what you are doing or about to do.

claims.claim: An air of mystery heightens presence and creates anticipation.
Mystery invites constant interpretation, never tires the public's attention.

warnings: The public will grow tired if you don't constantly renew attention.
People will take you for granted and move on to a newer star.

principles: Creating an air of mystery can make you more powerful and attractive to others.
Mystery is a powerful tool for leaders, artists, and con artists alike.
rules: To create an aura of mystery, be subtle and inconsistent in your words and actions.
Avoid being too obvious or predictable, as this can make you seem boring or uninteresting.

claims.claim: An air of mystery can make the mediocre appear intelligent and profound.
Mystery can draw attention to you and create an intimidating presence.

warnings: Don't let your air of mystery be slowly transformed into a reputation for deceit.
Be careful not to overdo it, as excessive mystery can lead to suspicion and mistrust.

principles: Never appear overly greedy for attention, then, for it signals insecurity, and insecurity drives power away.
Understand that there are times when it is not in your interest to be the center of attention.
rules: When in the presence of a king or queen, for instance, or the equivalent thereof, bow and retreat to the shadows; never compete.

claims.claim: Never do yourself what others can do for you.
The tortoise was not afraid and stayed where he was, so the elephant stepped on him, but could not crush him.

warnings: When Tesla met Edison in New York, the famous inventor hired him on the spot. Tesla worked eighteen-hour days, finding ways to improve the primitive Edison dynamos.

Tesla's obsession was to create an alternating-current system (AC) of electricity. Edison believed in the direct-current system (DC), and not only refused to support Tesla's research but later did all he could to sabotage him.

principles: To accomplish great things, one must not be afraid to take advantage of others' work and ideas.
One should learn to use the knowledge and wisdom of the past to gain power and recognition.
rules: Do not try to do everything on your own; instead, find people with skills and creativity you lack and hire them or take their work as your own.
Use the past as a storehouse of knowledge and wisdom to gain an advantage over others.

claims.claim: The credit for an invention or creation is as important as the invention itself.
One must be vigilant and ruthless in protecting one's creations from being stolen by others.

warnings: Do not be naive and think that you can succeed on your own without taking advantage of others' work and ideas.
Be aware that there are always vultures circling around, waiting to take advantage of your hard work and creativity.

chapters.chapter_title: Law 8: Make Other People Come to You - Use Bait If Necessary
principles: The essence of power is the ability to keep the initiative, to get others to react to your moves, to keep your opponent and those around you on the defensive.
rules: Do not force the other person to act; make them come to you instead.
Use bait if necessary to lure people into a trap or situation that benefits you.

claims.claim: An aggressive leader who initiates bold moves will eventually collapse due to their inability to see more than a couple of moves ahead and the unforeseen consequences of their actions.

warnings: Do not be greedy when taking credit for work done by others, as this can lead to accusations of deception.
Be careful not to jeopardize your standing in the short term by hogging the limelight.

principles: Mastering one's emotions is crucial for effective decision-making.

claims.claim: Anger can lead to poor decision-making and negative consequences.
Emotional control is essential for personal growth and development.

warnings: Allowing anger to influence your actions can have severe repercussions.
